original: Håkansson, Ola, läroverksadjunkt, Nässjö, f. 24/3/87 i Gladsax, Krist. 1., av Per H. o. Elna Olsdotter. Barn: Bengt f. 18 (tagit namnet Ohrelius), löjtn. v. flottan. — Mog:’ex. 07, fil. kand. 14 o. fil. mag. 16 i Lund, provår v. folksk:sem. o. norra latin i Sthlm 24-25. Vik. adj. i Sthlm 25-26, e. lär. där 26-36, adj. i modersm., hist. m. samh :lära o. geogr. v. Nässjö samrealsk. sed. 36. Lär. v. samt förest, f. Äsele priv. samsk. 16-19, förest, f. Äsele folkbildn:- o. hemb:fören. 17-19, bitr. sekr. i Nat:fören. mot emigr. o. red. f. tidskr. Hem i Sverige 19-24, timlär. v. Carlssons sk. i Sthlm 26-27, AUS 27-28, lär. i sv. språk. o. litt. v. KFUM sekr:inst. 26-35, lär. o. stud:-rektor v. Kungsh. ensk. lärov. i Sthlm 31-36. Bibi. v. Nässjö samrealsk. sed. 40. Ordf. i Sv. extralär:fören. 29-33. Medarb. i Hälsingb.-Posten 08, Lunds Dagbl. 10-11.
translated: Håkansson, Ola, high school teacher, Nässjö, born on March 24, 1887 in Gladsax, Kristianstad County, to Per H. and Elna Olsdotter. Children: Bengt born in 1918 (changed his name to Ohrelius), lieutenant in the navy. Ola earned his Bachelor's degree in Education in 1907, Bachelor's degree in Philosophy in 1914, and Master's degree in Philosophy in 1916 at Lund University. He completed his probationary year at a primary school and a secondary school in Stockholm from 1924-1925. He was a temporary teacher in Stockholm from 1925-1926, a permanent teacher in his mother language, history, social science, and geography at Nässjö Secondary School from 1926-1936. From 1916-1919, he was a teacher and head of school at Äsele Private Comprehensive School, and head of education and home association from 1917-1919. He was a deputy secretary in the National Association against Emigration and editor of the magazine Hem i Sverige from 1919-1924. From 1926-1927, he was an hourly teacher at Carlsson's School in Stockholm, AUS 27-28, and teacher in Swedish language and literature at KFUM Secretary Institute from 1926-1935. He was a teacher and study director at Kungsholmen Private High School in Stockholm from 1931-1936. He became a librarian at Nässjö Secondary School in 1940. He was chairman of the Swedish Extracurricular Teachers Association from 1929-1933 and a contributor to Hälsingb.-Posten in 1908 and Lunds Dagblad from 1910-1911.

workExperience.title: Probationary year at primary school and secondary school
